doc.previous: Several additional subspecies of lion existed in prehistoric times  Eight recent Holocene subspecies are recognised today
doc.after: Lions have been known to breed with tigers most often the Siberian and Bengal subspecies to create hybrids called ligers and tiglons or tigons 42 They also have been crossed with leopards to produce leopons 43 and jaguars to produce jaglions The marozi is reputedly a spotted lion or a naturally occurring leopon while the Congolese spotted lion is a complex lion jaguar leopard hybrid called a lijagulep Such hybrids were once commonly bred in zoos but this is now discouraged due to the emphasis on conserving species and subspecies Hybrids are still bred in private menageries and in zoos in China
